description.p: Channel cosmic forces of order shaped by Mechanus and its modrons.
When you choose this subclass at 3rd level, you gain the following features.

When you cast a Sorcerer spell, your link to order can show in various ways: spectral cogwheels, clock hands spinning in your eyes, brassy sheen on the skin, floating equations and geometric objects, your focus becoming a tiny mechanism, or ordered sounds of whirring and ticking. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Clockwork Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

tr.td: Aid, Alarm, Lesser Restoration, Protection from Evil and Good

description.p: These spells do not count against the number of spells you can prepare. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

Reaction. When a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with Advantage or Disadvantage, you can use your Reaction to negate Advantage or Disadvantage for that roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

sheet.description: When a creature within 60 ft rolls with Advantage or Disadvantage, you negate Advantage or Disadvantage for that roll.

description.p: Bonus Action. You can spend 1 to 5 Sorcery Points to create a magical ward that lasts until you finish a Long Rest or you use this feature again. The ward has a number of d8s equal to the Sorcery Points spent.
When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet takes damage, you can use your Reaction to expend any number of the ward's d8s, roll them, and reduce the damage by the total rolled.

sheet.description: Spend 1-5 SP to create a ward on you or on a creature within 30 ft of you. The ward has a number of d8 equal to the SP spent. As a Reaction: when takes damage, expend any number of those d8 to reduce the damage by the total rolled. The ward ends when dice are gone or after a Long Rest.

description.p: Bonus Action. You enter a trance for 1 minute. For the duration, attacks cannot gain Advantage against you, and any attack roll or ability check you make that is a 9 or lower on the d20 counts as a 10.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

sheet.description: For 1 minute: attacks cannot have Advantage against you; your d20 results of 9 or lower on attack rolls and ability checks count as 10. You can restore one use by spending 5 Sorcery Points.

description.p: Magic Action. You summon a 30-foot cube of clockwork spirits that mends the world in three ways: it restores hit points to creatures of your choice in the area, repairs damaged objects and structures in the area, and ends certain ongoing spells in the area (as specified by the feature).
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.
